column4: Howdy. When I run apt-get update I need to have my http_proxy env variable set. I have this in /etc/profile but that isn't sourced upon startup. Any hints as to how I should tell apt to use my http_proxy or otherwise get /etc/profile sourced on startup?
/etc/init.d/bootmisc.sh is sourced at boot time
thanks
but... you can set a proxy using system->admin->network-proxy
in GNOME, the system menu is in the top left corner
ahhh...using KDE :)
the command is 'gnome-network-preferences' - but I don't know if that will work in KDE...
yup that works..thanks :)
what kind of terminals?
xterm and konsole
for konsole you might try asking in #kubuntu
for xterm, hold control and press middle-mouse-button - there's a menu to select 'visual bell'
thanks again :)
xterm also has a "-vb" option, to set "visual bell"
actually, I don't hear any beeps from xterm at all - I must have turned off the beeper somehow.  I don't see it flash either.  Not sure what I've done.  Maybe the hardware beeper is broken?
i feel like breaking mine :P
I just tried in a virtual console - it's silent there too
did you try "xset -b"?  that turns the bell off
that worked! thanks
welcome.  anything else?
nope that is all for now :)  bye
